backend.src.app.repositories.employees package

Submodules

backend.src.app.repositories.employees.employee_repository module

class backend.src.app.repositories.employees.employee_repository.EmployeeRepository(employee_id=None, employee_email=None)[source]

Bases: object

The EmployeeRepository class encapsulates the logic necessary to access the database and perform CRUD operations on the Employee model.

Variables:

  • employee_id – Unique identifier for an employee. Used for retrieving an existing employee by ID.

  • employee_email – Unique email for an employee. Used for retrieving an existing employee by email.

  • employee – Instance of the Employee model representing an employee in the database.

delete()[source]

Delete the current employee instance from the database.

get_employee()[source]

Retrieve the current employee instance.

Returns:

Returns the current employee instance or None if it doesn’t exist.

Return type:

Employee or None

get_employee_all_data()[source]

Retrieve all data of the current employee instance.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary containing all data of the current employee instance. Contains following keys: - id (int): The employee’s ID. - name (str): The employee’s name. - surname (str): The employee’s surname. - email (str): The employee’s email. - phone (str): The employee’s phone. - salary (int): The employee’s salary. - position (str): The employee’s position.

Return type:

dict[str, any]

get_employee_hash_password()[source]

Retrieve the current employee hash password.

Returns:

Returns the current employee hash password or None if it doesn’t exist.

Return type:

str or None

get_employee_profile_data()[source]

Retrieve profile data of the current employee instance.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary containing profile data of the current employee instance. Contains following keys: - id (int): The employee’s ID. - name (str): The employee’s name. - surname (str): The employee’s surname. - email (str): The employee’s email. - phone (str): The employee’s phone. - salary (int): The employee’s salary. - position (str): The employee’s position. - latest_rentals (list[int]): The employee’s latest conducted rental IDs.

Return type:

dict[str, any]

save()[source]

Save the current employee instance to the database.

update(update_data)[source]

Update the current employee instance based on the provided update data.

Parameters:

update_data (dict[str, any]) – Dictionary containing new values for the employee’s attributes.

Returns:

Returns True if the update was successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

backend.src.app.repositories.employees.employees_repository module

class backend.src.app.repositories.employees.employees_repository.EmployeesRepository(create_data=None)[source]

Bases: object

The EmployeesRepository class provides methods for creating, retrieving, and sorting Employee objects.

This class acts as a repository and uses the Employee model to perform operations related to employees.

create()[source]

Creates an Employee instance.

This method takes the employee data provided during the initialization of the repository, validates it, and if valid, creates an Employee instance.

Returns:

True if the employee was created, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

get_all()[source]

Retrieves all Employee instances.

This method fetches all the Employee instances from the database and stores the result in self.employees_data.

Returns:

A list of all Employee instances.

Return type:

list[Employee]

sort_all(sort_data)[source]

Sorts all Employee instances based on the provided sorting parameters and stores the result.

Parameters:

sort_data (dict[str, any]) – Dictionary containing the sorting parameters.

Returns:

A sorted list of all Employee instances if the sorting parameters are valid, None otherwise.

Return type:

list[Employee] or None
